SEARCH
Module PSP24
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents a game instance in the application. This class manages the game state, including players, cards, board setup, and game progression. It follows the MVC (Model-View-Controller) pattern where it serves as the central model component.

    • createGame

      public void createGame(GameListenerInterface lis, String nickname)
      Creates a new game instance with the specified listener and nickname. Notifies listeners about the requirement of the number of players and game ID.
      Parameters:
      lis - The listener to notify about game events.
      nickname - The nickname associated with the player creating the game.

    • addPlayer

      public boolean addPlayer(GameListenerInterface lis, String nickname, Color playerColor)
      Adds a new player to the game with the specified nickname and player color. Notifies listeners about the player's addition and handles various scenarios such as game being full or nickname already taken.
      Parameters:
      lis - The GameListenerInterface to notify.
      nickname - The nickname of the player to add.
      playerColor - The color of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the player was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • chooseOrderPlayers

      public void chooseOrderPlayers()
      Randomly selects a player to start the game and determines the order of players. Updates the current player and order of players array accordingly.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String nickname)
      The function removes the player with username "username" from the game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - is the nickname of the Player that you want to remove from the game.

    • arePlayersReadyToStartAndEnough

    • setInitialStatus

      public void setInitialStatus()
      Sets the initial RUNNING game status If I want to set the gameStatus to "RUNNING", there needs to be at least DefaultValue.minNumberOfPlayers -> (2) in lobby, the right number of Cards on the Board and a valid currentPlayer

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn(int currentIndex) throws GameEndedException
      Advances the game to the next turn based on the current player index. Throws if it's thGameEndedExceptione last circle and the current player index is the last player index.
      Parameters:
      currentIndex - the index of the current player
      Throws:
      GameEndedException - if it's the last circle and the current player index is the last player index

    • lastTurnGoalCheck

      public void lastTurnGoalCheck()
      Checks for each player of the game his personal goal and the common goals.

    • checkGoal

      public void checkGoal(Player p, ObjectiveCard goalToCheck)
      Checks the given objective card against the player's book to add points.
      Parameters:
      p - the player to check the goals
      goalToCheck - the objective card to check against the player's book

    • initializeCards

      public void initializeCards(GameListenerInterface lis, Player player, int index)
      Initializes the cards for the game. Each player picks Distributes initial cards, objective cards, resource cards, and gold cards to each player.
      Parameters:
      player - that is involved in the initialization and whose listeners are notified
      index - indexPlayer

    • setInitialCard

      public void setInitialCard(Player player, int pos)
      Sets the initial card front or back chosen in the book of the given player
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the initial card will be set.
      pos - The position of the temporary initial card to choose from. This index is used to fetch the card from the `temporaryInitialCard` array.

    • getIndexPlayer

      public int getIndexPlayer(Player p)
      Retrieves the index of the specified player in the list of players.
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose index needs to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the index of the player if found; otherwise, -1

    • drawObjectiveCards

      public ObjectiveCard[] drawObjectiveCards() throws IllegalStateException, DeckEmptyException
      Draws two objective cards from the board's objective card deck. to be chosen by the player
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing two drawn objective cards from the deck.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the game has already started and cards cannot be drawn.
      DeckEmptyException - If the objective card deck is empty.

    • setPlayerGoal

      public void setPlayerGoal(Player player, int index)
      Assigns the chosen objective card to a specific player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to whom the chosen objective card will be assigned.
      index - the idenx of the objective card to be assigned to the player.

    • placeCardTurn

      public int placeCardTurn(Player p, int chosenCard, int rowCell, int colCell)
      Handles the player's turn to place a card on the board. This method allows a player to place a specified card in a cell on his book. If the card is successfully placed, it returns the number of points of the card. or sends notifies to tje listeners to ask to choose another card/cell
      Parameters:
      p - the player who is placing the card.
      chosenCard - the card chosen by the player to place on the board.
      rowCell - the row index of the cell in which to place the card.
      colCell - the column index of the cell in which to place the card.
      Returns:
      the number of points gained from placing the card successfully.

    • getCurrentCardPoints

      public int getCurrentCardPoints()
      Retrieves the current points associated with the current card in the game.
      Returns:
      the current points of the current card

    • addPoints

      public void addPoints(Player p, int points)
      Adds points to the specified player and notifies listeners about the points added.
      Parameters:
      p - the player to whom points will be added
      points - the points to add to the player

    • pickCardTurn

      public void pickCardTurn(Player p, CardType cardType, boolean drawFromDeck, int pos)
      Allows a player to pick a card from the board and add it to their deck. Notifies listeners about the card drawn or if the game ends due to an empty deck.
      Parameters:
      p - the player picking the card
      cardType - the type of card to pick (Treasure or Hazard)
      drawFromDeck - true if drawing from the deck, false if from the discard pile
      pos - position on the board or deck from which to pick the card
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the player's deck is full

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Retrieves the current game board.
      Returns:
      the Board object representing the current game board.

    • getTemporaryInitialCardsDeck

      public ArrayList<PlayableCard[]> getTemporaryInitialCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the temporary deck of initial playable cards. This method returns an ArrayList of arrays containing PlayableCard objects which represent the temporary initial cards deck.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of PlayableCard arrays representing the temporary initial cards deck.

    • getTemporaryObjectiveCardsDeck

      public ArrayList<ObjectiveCard[]> getTemporaryObjectiveCardsDeck()
      Retrieves the temporary deck of objective cards. This method returns an ArrayList of arrays containing ObjectiveCard objects which represent the temporary objective cards deck.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ObjectiveCard arrays representing the temporary objective cards deck.

    • reconnectPlayer

      public boolean reconnectPlayer(GameListenerInterface lis, Player p)
      Attempts to reconnect a player who was previously disconnected. Notifies listeners about the reconnection status and handles game progression if necessary.
      Parameters:
      lis - the listener interface for the reconnected player
      p - the player to reconnect
      Returns:
      true if the reconnection is successful, false otherwise

    • checkPlayerStatus

      public void checkPlayerStatus(Player p)
      Checks the status of the reconnected player and ensures that their deck and the board have the correct number of cards in case they were lost during the disconnection * @param p The player whose status is being checked.

      Returns:

    • sentMessage

      public void sentMessage(Message msg)
      Receives a message from a player, adds it to the chat, and notifies listeners about the message.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message object containing sender and text
      Throws:
      ActionByAPlayerNotInTheGameException - if the sender of the message is not a participant in the game
